lines.text: Excuse me, was there a big yellow bird on this plane?
Well, only me.

[not catching on]
Oh, too bad. Maybe he'll be on the next plane.
Now, here today, we have a sad, sad case that needs our urgent attention. He's only six years old, and he lives all alone, with no other birds around.
He looks so sad.
That's funny. He looks happy to me.

[surprised]
Of course he's not happy! How can you say that?
[the board members begin arguing around the table]
Madame Chairbird!
Miss Finch?

[clearing throat]
We all know he can't be happy. He needs to be with his own kind, with a bird family.
True, very true.
And I know just the family. Where does he live?
Sesame Street.
Can you tell me how to get to Sesame Street?
Oh, Bird, this is goodbye. You're leaving Sesame Street.
Well, I'm not really leaving. I'm just going away.
Oh.
Besides, as soon as I get to Ocean View, you can come and visit.
I can?
First thing, ol' pal. I wouldn't go if you couldn't come and visit.
Come on, Big Bird, you don't want to miss your plane.
Just a minute. Give me a big hug, Big Bird.
[they embrace]
Don't forget to write.
I won't, Maria.
Don't forget to count, Big Bird!
Okay, Count.
And don't forget to dress warmly, okay, Big Bird?
I've got my muffler, Bob.
Don't forget to breathe! In and out!
I always do, Grover.
[Linda signs something to Big Bird]
I'll read every day.
Don't forget to eat, Big Bird!
I won't, Cookie Monster.
[Oscar comes slowly out of his trash can]
Well, goodbye, Oscar.

[surprised]
What? Why, that's the nicest thing you've ever said to me.

[reading a letter from Big Bird to Sesame Street]
... So that's my new home. I should be happy here.
[pause]
What's wrong with me?
[then, with great surprise]
Love, Big Dodo?
[everyone begins whispering amongst themselves]

[finishing the letter]
Big Bird to you.
Hey, I've got a great idea. Let's play make-believe. I'll be Snow White.
But you're not Snow White.
You're bright yellow.
Yeah.

[not choosing to notice this remark]
And you could be the Seven Dwarves.
But we're not dwarves.
We're birds.
I said we just could make believe. You know, pretend? Uh, use your imagination.
Oh, okay. I'll pretend I'm Donnie.
And I'll pretend I'm Marie.
[Big Bird sighs with disgust]
This news just in, concerning a 6-year-old runaway. The runaway is an eight-foot yellow bird who answers to the name Big Bird.
Did you say Big Bird?
That's right, Big Bird. He left his nest in Ocean View, Illinois last night, and is reportedly heading east for a place called Sesaim Street.
Sesaim Street?

[after hearing corrections from someone off-camera]
Sesame Street. Sorry.
Oh!
Here now with the report is our correspondent, Kermit the Frog.

[to someone else]
Okay. Here's one. Why does the chicken NOT cross the road? 'Cause it's chicken. Get it?
[he laughs, then turns to the camera, as he's on]

"Dear Dodos, you are a very nice family. Thanks for everything, but I'm walking back to Sesame Street. I should be there in three hours, since it took two hours to fly here. So if anyone calls, you know where to reach me. Love, Big Bird." And here is the family that he left, the Dodos.
Oh, are we on television?
Um, yes, you are.
Let's go inside and watch!
Uh, now who'd run away from a family like that?
Whattaya see, Ernie?

[points his binoculars at Bert's nose]
Your nose, Bert.
[he laughs]
Ernie! Get serious, will ya? We're supposed to be looking for Big Bird.
Right!

[to a truck of turkeys]
Hey, fellas, can you give me a lift? Talk to who?
[turns to see a man loading another crate of turkeys into the truck]
Oh, say, you must be the driver.
Well, what can I do for you, big fella?
Well, do you have room for just one more?
I don't take no riders. This here's a turkey truck.
Oh well.
[Then a thought hits him]
But my friend Oscar always says that I'm a big turkey!
Well, I don't guess I can argue with that. Hop in.
So you are the bird on the run.
Oh, yeah, and I can't wait to get back to my real home on Sesame Street. I figure I can walk back there in, oh, about three hours.
Three hours?
[shakes his head]
More like three weeks, buddy.
Three weeks? Oh, no. I'll never get home!
Sure, you will. You've just got to keep going. Pick up your feet and follow your beak.
That eight-foot bird is still on the lam. You know, Sid, people would pay money to see that bird.
Nah, I wouldn't pay to see no bird.
No, no, no. People would pay us to see that bird! Us, us, us!
Gee. There's still no sign of Sesame Street. Nothing but amber waves of grain. I think I'm lost. What'll I do? I wish Snuffy were here. Then I'd be lost with my best friend.
[at that moment, a mirage-like image of Snuffy appears in the field]
Hello, Bird.
Snuffy? I thought I'd never see you again! I can hardly see you now.
That is because you are imagining me, Bird.
Oh. Well, it's so good to almost see you. I suppose a hug is out of the question, you being imaginary right now.
You could imagine that we're hugging, Bird.
That's right. How brilliant. Here it comes.
[Big Bird and Snuffleupagus try to hug, but keep passing through each other]
Oh, I'm afraid this isn't working, Snuffy. For hugging, you need the real thing.
Don't worry, Bird. We can hug for real when you get back to Sesame Street.
''If'' I ever get back to Sesame Street. But I will.

[shouting]
How could you miss him? He's eight feet tall!

[shouting]
You were going too fast!

[whispering]
Sid, don't shout at me.

[whispering]
You were going too fast.
Let's not get mad. We'll just start all over.

[shouting]
Now let's get going!

[driving into a junkyard]
This is where I wanna be - grouch paradise! Just look it at. It's like a work of art.
It is different, Maria.
Oscar, I want you to turn this car around right now and head for Toadstool!
Ah, an angry face in a beautiful place - heaven.
Say, there's a lady named Miss Finch who's chasing me and, uh, do you mind if I hide in your fun fair?
Why, no, not at all. We have the perfect place for you to hide. Right here in our hiding cage.
[Locks him up]
You'll be safe here.
Yeah, real safe.
Gee, thanks.
[Sid and Sam laugh]
Let's go!
Ha, ha, ha! Oh, gee, I sure am a lucky bird.

[voiceover]
"Sesame Street" is brought to you today by the letters W and B.
[first lines]
Ladies and gentlemen, would you please rise for the Grouch Anthem.
No, no, no! With the Grouch Anthem, you stay sitting down! Down in front there!

[after the Grouch Anthem]
Well, anyway, you've seen the best part of this movie, so sit back, relax, and have a rotten time!
Are you all right, Big? You are Big Bird?

[looking himself over]
Yeah, I guess I am.

[facing the camera]
This is worse than I thought!
Isn't flying wonderful? It makes me feel like a bird.
Ernie, I see him!
See who, Bert?
See that yellow spot down there? It's Big Bird!
Oh, yeah. That sure looks like a yellow spot, all right.

[lands in the Volkswagen]
This is not Big Bird! You are imposters!

[Notices Cookie Monster is still consuming the Volkswagen]
Haven't you had enough?
But Gordon, me growing monster!

[Shocked to see that there's nothing left of her car]
Gordon! What on earth happened to the car?
Don't ask me.

[Points to Cookie Monster]
Ask him.

[Looks up at Ruthie]
Hi.

[Belches]
Oh, excuse me.
The insurance man isn't going to believe this.
[last lines]

[at the very end]
That's 278 incredible, colossal credits! Ha-ha, I love motion pictures! Wonderful! Ha-ha-ha-ha-ha!

[singing]
Let this be the Grouch's cause! Point out everybody's flaws! Something is wrong with everything, except the way I sing!
You know, Big, you shouldn't be living here all alone.
Well, I'm not all alone. Why, there's Gordon and Susan and...
But they're not birds like we are.
I know, but they're nice people.
But you should have a home and a family.
Well, I am home. I like it here on Sesame Street.

Wouldn't you like to be with your own kind? Wouldn't you like to live in a big, beautiful bird house with a nice bird family of your own? And a brother bird, and a sister bird, and a father bird, and a mother bird? And sing and play bird games all day long? Wouldn't you? Wouldn't you?
[Big Bird imagines life with a bird family]
Gee, I think I'd like that!
Good! Because in a lovely city called Ocean View, Ilinois, there's a fine feathered family waiting just for you!
Really? Oh, when can I leave?
Who's Mr. Sniffuplaga
[struggles with the name]
Sniffleblguh
Uh, Snuffleupagus.
Yeah.
Well, he's my best friend.
What kind of a bird is he?
He's not a bird. He's a Snuffleupagus.
[the Dodos laugh]
But your best friend should be a bird.
Why?
Because you're a bird. Isn't that right, Daddy?
birds.
You'll find lots of birds your own age.
And make some new best friends. Now come on out and hunt for worms.
But I don't want to hunt worms. I want Snuffy to come and visit. And if he can't come and visit, I don't want to be here anymore. I want to go home!
But you are home!
Okay. Let's... Follow that Bird!
You think maybe he didn't like it here or something?
Impossible!
Well, what are you going to do about it, Miss Finch?
I'm going to find Big Bird, wherever he is, and bring him back to the Dodos.
You're the biggest chicken I've ever seen.
Oh, I'm not a chicken actually. I'm a bird on the run.
Oh yeah. Floyd, he's the bird on TV who ran away.
Oh, I didn't run away. I'm going back to my real home on Sesame Street where I belong.
[yawns]
Are you tired?
Well, maybe a little. I sure wish I had a place to sleep.
Have you ever slept in a barn?

[looking toward the barn]
Hmm.
One! One Joan Ganz Cooney! Hi, Mom!

[Picks up the kid that got his apple stolen by Sam Sleaze]
Are these the two men?
[the kid nods his head]
What seems to be the problem, officer? What's the charge?

[looks through his notebook]
What about counterfeiting, extortion, fraud, impersonating a dentist, stealing an apple from a kid?
Oh, about that apple, officer, I can explain that. We was just holding it for a friend.
Yeah, for a friend.
You can tell that to the judge.

[crying]
The judge, Sam!
Be a man.
But I don't wanna be a man, Sam!
Shut up, Sid! Shut up!

[crying]
The judge, Sam! Jail!
Nice work, turkey!
[at the gas station after everyone has met up again]
Hey, Count, baby, what's happenin'?
[gives the Count a high-five]
Five, jive!

[over phone]
He's at some kind of carnival.
At a carnival?
That fun fair!
[signs something]
We passed that hours ago!
That's what she just said!
